speaker: Elena
text: I’ve just found a bug in the modal component that displays user notifications.
ipa: aɪv dʒʌst faʊnd ə bʌɡ ɪn ðə ˈməʊ.dəl kəmˈpəʊ.nənt ðæt dɪsˈpleɪz ˈjuː.zər ˌnəʊ.tɪ.fɪˈkeɪ.ʃənz.
stress: I'VE JUST FOUND a BUG in the MODAL COMPONENT that DISPLAYS USER NOTIFICATIONS.

speaker: Victor
text: Is it the one which we refactored last sprint?
ipa: ɪz ɪt ðə wʌn wɪʧ wiː riːˈfæk.təd lɑːst sprɪnt?
stress: IS it the ONE which we REFACTORED LAST SPRINT?

speaker: Elena
text: Yes. The logic that controls visibility doesn’t handle async responses properly anymore.
ipa: jɛs. ðə ˈlɒ.dʒɪk ðæt kənˈtrəʊlz ˌvɪ.zəˈbɪ.lə.ti ˈdʌz.ənt ˈhæn.dl ˈeɪ.sɪŋk rɪˈspɒn.sɪz ˈprɒ.pə.li ˌɛ.niˈmɔː.
stress: YES. The LOGIC that CONTROLS VISIBILITY DOESN'T HANDLE ASYNC RESPONSES PROPERLY ANYMORE.

speaker: Victor
text: Hmm. The feature flag system, which is supposed to control that logic, must be interfering.
ipa: hmm. ðə ˈfiː.tʃər flæɡ ˈsɪs.təm wɪʧ ɪz səˈpəʊzd tuː kənˈtrəʊl ðæt ˈlɒ.dʒɪk mʌst biː ˌɪn.təˈfɪə.rɪŋ.
stress: HMM. The FEATURE FLAG SYSTEM, which is SUPPOSED to CONTROL that LOGIC, MUST be INTERFERING.

speaker: Elena
text: I think so. I talked to Priya, who owns the toggle service, and she said the fallback values were recently updated.
ipa: aɪ θɪŋk səʊ. aɪ tɔːkt tuː ˈpriː.jə huː əʊnz ðə ˈtɒɡ.l̩ ˈsɜː.vɪs ənd ʃiː sɛd ðə ˈfɔːl.bæk ˈvæl.juːz wə ˈriː.sənt.li ʌpˈdeɪ.tɪd.
stress: I THINK SO. I TALKED to PRIYA, who OWNS the TOGGLE SERVICE, and SHE SAID the FALLBACK VALUES were RECENTLY UPDATED.

speaker: Victor
text: She’s the engineer whose idea it was to add the fallback system in the first place.
ipa: ʃiːz ði ˌɛn.dʒɪˈnɪə huːz aɪˈdɪə ɪt wəz tuː æd ðə ˈfɔːl.bæk ˈsɪs.təm ɪn ðə fɜːst pleɪs.
stress: SHE'S the ENGINEER whose IDEA it WAS to ADD the FALLBACK SYSTEM in the FIRST PLACE.

speaker: Elena
text: Right, and she showed me a test that simulates latency but doesn't assert proper state cleanup.
ipa: raɪt ənd ʃiː ʃəʊd miː ə tɛst ðæt ˈsɪm.jʊ.leɪts ˈleɪ.tən.si bət ˈdʌz.ənt əˈsɜːt ˈprɒ.pə steɪt ˈkliː.nʌp.
stress: RIGHT, and SHE SHOWED me a TEST that SIMULATES LATENCY but DOESN'T ASSERT PROPER STATE CLEANUP.

speaker: Victor
text: Maybe we should add a test case which mimics slower backend responses?
ipa: ˈmeɪ.bi wiː ʃʊd æd ə tɛst keɪs wɪʧ ˈmɪ.mɪks ˈsləʊ.ər ˈbæk.ɛnd rɪˈspɒn.sɪz?
stress: MAYBE we SHOULD ADD a TEST CASE which MIMICS SLOWER BACKEND RESPONSES?

speaker: Elena
text: Good idea. Also, the documentation that came with the toggle library is a bit vague on edge cases.
ipa: ɡʊd aɪˈdɪə. ˈɔːl.səʊ ðə ˌdɒk.jʊ.menˈteɪ.ʃən ðæt keɪm wɪð ðə ˈtɒɡ.l̩ ˈlaɪ.brə.ri ɪz ə bɪt veɪɡ ɒn ɛdʒ keɪsɪz.
stress: GOOD IDEA. ALSO, the DOCUMENTATION that CAME with the TOGGLE LIBRARY is a BIT VAGUE on EDGE CASES.

speaker: Victor
text: That’s probably the reason why we missed this in the first place.
ipa: ðæts ˈprɒ.bə.bli ðə ˈriː.zən waɪ wiː mɪst ðɪs ɪn ðə fɜːst pleɪs.
stress: THAT'S PROBABLY the REASON WHY we MISSED THIS in the FIRST PLACE.

speaker: Elena
text: Exactly. It’s one of those bugs that only appears when everything else is slightly off.
ipa: ɪɡˈzæk.tli. ɪts wʌn əv ðəʊz bʌɡz ðæt ˈəʊn.li əˈpɪəz wen ˈev.ri.θɪŋ els ɪz ˈslaɪt.li ɒf.
stress: EXACTLY. IT'S ONE of THOSE BUGS that ONLY APPEARS when EVERYTHING ELSE is SLIGHTLY OFF.
